definitions.definition: The form of existence belonging to a particular object, entity etc.; a mode of being.
the change undergone by a word when used in a construction (for instance am => 'm in I'm )
The result of modifying something; a new or changed form.
The act of making a change to something while keeping its essential character intact; an alteration or adjustment .
examples: Jim's modification to the radio's tuning resulted in clearer sound.

definitions.definition: A change to an organism as a result of its environment that is not transmissable to offspring .
examples: Due to his sunbathing, Jim's body experienced modifications : he got a tan.

definitions.definition: a change to a word when it is borrowed by another language
examples: The Chinese word "kòu tóu" had a modification made to become the English "kowtow".

main_definition: ( obsolete , philosophy ) The form of existence belonging to a particular object, entity etc.; a mode of being. [17th–19th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( linguistics ) the change undergone by a word when used in a construction (for instance am => 'm in I'm ) [from 17th c.]
The result of modifying something; a new or changed form. [from 17th c.]
The act of making a change to something while keeping its essential character intact; an alteration or adjustment . [from 18th c.]
( biology ) A change to an organism as a result of its environment that is not transmissable to offspring . [from 19th c.]
( linguistics ) a change to a word when it is borrowed by another language
